channel.title: Webclient freezes at unpacking
channel.description: OK this is the steps I have done in creating my webclient 1. uploaded my cache to dropbox, and it was a .zip 2.edited the CacheDownloader link in the cachedownloader.java wich now looks like: [code=java]private String cacheLink = "my cache link here"; // Link to cache[/code] (i put "my cache link here" in the place of where the link should be because I feel if I put the real link it would be advertising) 3. edited the updater link in the client.java wich now looks like: [code=java] new Update("my cache link here", "BDCache", signlink.findcachedir());[/code] (^) 4. Jar'd and signed my client then uploaded it to a html hosting site after creating a html page to host it on this is where my problem is: I renamed my cache in my (C:) drive to BDCache2 to try and load the webclient for myself and it worked all the way untill it got to the unpacking, at that point it just froze. then I went back into my (C:) drive and renamed BDCache2 back to the originol name (BDCache) and then it webclient worked just fine. can anyone help me?

item.title: Webclient freezes at unpacking
item.dc:creator: @blo0d_pker blo0d pker
item.description:
@blo0d_pker wrote:

that’s just it!
you see the only reason BDCache worked was because it’s cache you download while loading this webclient
i changed it to BDCache2 to see if I was capable of loading the webclient myself wich I wasn’t because it freezes at the part of unpacking
and when I changed it to BDCache is works, wich means the webclient cannot be downloadable for some odd apparent reaosn, and therefor my problem would be how can I fix the freeze at unpacking?

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient freezes at unpacking
item.dc:creator: @runewings317 runewings317
item.description:
@runewings317 wrote:

You said you named BDCache to BDCache2, it froze, you chained it back and it worked…

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient freezes at unpacking
item.dc:creator: @blo0d_pker blo0d pker
item.description:
@blo0d_pker wrote:

that wasn’t the problem…
the problem was that the webclient freezes once it gets to the unpacking part, I DON’T CARE WHAT THE CACHE IS CALLED
PLUS I ALREDY NAMED IT BDCache AND I DON’T WANT IT NAMED BDCache2!
no offense but please read my problem before answering it?=\

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient freezes at unpacking
item.dc:creator: @runewings317 runewings317
item.description:
@runewings317 wrote:

If you want the 2 afte the cache, your going to have to search through all your files, looking for the original cache name and add a 2 at the end.

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient freezes at unpacking
item.dc:creator: @blo0d_pker blo0d pker
item.description:
@blo0d_pker wrote:

OK this is the steps I have done in creating my webclient

  1. uploaded my cache to dropbox, and it was a .zip
    2.edited the CacheDownloader link in the cachedownloader.java wich now looks like:
private String cacheLink = "my cache link here"; // Link to cache

(i put “my cache link here” in the place of where the link should be because I feel if I put the real link it would be advertising)
3. edited the updater link in the client.java wich now looks like:

 new Update("my cache link here", "BDCache", signlink.findcachedir());

(^)
4. Jar’d and signed my client then uploaded it to a html hosting site after creating a html page to host it on
this is where my problem is: I renamed my cache in my (C:) drive to BDCache2 to try and load the webclient for myself and it worked all the way
untill it got to the unpacking, at that point it just froze.
then I went back into my (C:) drive and renamed BDCache2 back to the originol name (BDCache) and then it webclient worked just fine.
can anyone help me?

Read full topic
